name: ObservableMap
comment: Represents an observable map of model values. If any items are added, removed, or replaced, then observers that are listening to polymer/polymer.ChangeNotifier.changes will be notified.

isEmpty.name: isEmpty
isEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is no key-value pair in the map.

isNotEmpty.name: isNotEmpty
isNotEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is at least one key-value pair in the map.

keys.name: keys
keys.comment:
The keys of this.

The returned iterable has efficient length and contains operations, based on polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.length and polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.containsKey of the map.

The order of iteration is defined by the individual Map implementation, but must be consistent between changes to the map.

length.name: length
length.comment: The number of key-value pairs in the map.

values.name: values
values.comment:
The values of this.

The values are iterated in the order of their corresponding keys. This means that iterating polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.keys and polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.values in parrallel will provided matching pairs of keys and values.

The returned iterable has an efficient length method based on the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.length of the map.

from.name: from
from.comment:
Creates an observable map that contains all key value pairs of polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.ObservableMap-from.other. It will attempt to use the same backing map type if the other map is a polymer/dart-collection.LinkedHashMap, polymer/dart-collection.SplayTreeMap, or polymer/dart-collection.HashMap. Otherwise it defaults to polymer/dart-collection.HashMap.

Note this will perform a shallow conversion. If you want a deep conversion you should use polymer/polymer.toObservable.

linked.name: linked
linked.comment: Creates a new observable map using a polymer/dart-collection.LinkedHashMap.

sorted.name: sorted
sorted.comment: Creates a new observable map using a polymer/dart-collection.SplayTreeMap.

[].comment: Returns the value for the given polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[].key or null if polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[].key is not in the map. Because null values are supported, one should either use polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.containsKey to distinguish between an absent key and a null value, or use the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent method.

[]=.comment:
Associates the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[]=.key with the given polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[]=.value.

If the key was already in the map, its associated value is changed. Otherwise the key-value pair is added to the map.

addAll.name: addAll
addAll.comment:
Adds all key-value pairs of polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.addAll.other to this map.

If a key of polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.addAll.other is already in this map, its value is overwritten.

The operation is equivalent to doing this[key] = value for each key and associated value in other. It iterates over polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.addAll.other, which must therefore not change during the iteration.

clear.name: clear
clear.comment:
Removes all pairs from the map.

After this, the map is empty.

containsKey.name: containsKey
containsKey.comment: Returns true if this map contains the given key.

containsValue.name: containsValue
containsValue.comment: Returns true if this map contains the given value.

forEach.name: forEach
forEach.comment:
Applies polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.forEach.f to each {key, value} pair of the map.

Adding or removing keys from the map during iteration is not allowed.

putIfAbsent.name: putIfAbsent
putIfAbsent.comment:
If polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.key is not associated to a value, calls polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent and updates the map by mapping polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.key to the value returned by polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent. Returns the value in the map.

Map<String, int> scores = {'Bob': 36};
for (var key in ['Bob', 'Rohan', 'Sophena']) {
  scores.putIfAbsent(key, () => key.length);
}
scores['Bob'];      // 36
scores['Rohan'];    //  5
scores['Sophena'];  //  7

The code that polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent executes must not add or remove keys.

remove.name: remove
remove.comment: Removes the association for the given polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.remove.key. Returns the value for polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.remove.key in the map or null if polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.remove.key is not in the map. Note that values can be null and a returned null value does not always imply that the key is absent.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

changes.name: changes
changes.comment:
The stream of change records to this object. Records will be delivered asynchronously.

polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.deliverChanges can be called to force synchronous delivery.

hasObservers.name: hasObservers
hasObservers.comment: True if this object has any observers, and should call polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.notifyPropertyChange for changes.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

isEmpty.name: isEmpty
isEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is no key-value pair in the map.

isNotEmpty.name: isNotEmpty
isNotEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is at least one key-value pair in the map.

keys.name: keys
keys.comment:
The keys of this.

The returned iterable has efficient length and contains operations, based on polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.length and polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.containsKey of the map.

The order of iteration is defined by the individual Map implementation, but must be consistent between changes to the map.

length.name: length
length.comment: The number of key-value pairs in the map.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

values.name: values
values.comment:
The values of this.

The values are iterated in the order of their corresponding keys. This means that iterating polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.keys and polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.values in parrallel will provided matching pairs of keys and values.

The returned iterable has an efficient length method based on the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.length of the map.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

[].comment: Returns the value for the given polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[].key or null if polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[].key is not in the map. Because null values are supported, one should either use polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.containsKey to distinguish between an absent key and a null value, or use the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent method.

[]=.comment:
Associates the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[]=.key with the given polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.[]=.value.

If the key was already in the map, its associated value is changed. Otherwise the key-value pair is added to the map.

addAll.name: addAll
addAll.comment:
Adds all key-value pairs of polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.addAll.other to this map.

If a key of polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.addAll.other is already in this map, its value is overwritten.

The operation is equivalent to doing this[key] = value for each key and associated value in other. It iterates over polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.addAll.other, which must therefore not change during the iteration.

clear.name: clear
clear.comment:
Removes all pairs from the map.

After this, the map is empty.

containsKey.name: containsKey
containsKey.comment: Returns true if this map contains the given key.

containsValue.name: containsValue
containsValue.comment: Returns true if this map contains the given value.

deliverChanges.name: deliverChanges
deliverChanges.comment: Synchronously deliver pending polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.changes. Returns true if any records were delivered, otherwise false.

forEach.name: forEach
forEach.comment:
Applies polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.forEach.f to each {key, value} pair of the map.

Adding or removing keys from the map during iteration is not allowed.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

notifyChange.name: notifyChange
notifyChange.comment:
Notify observers of a change.

For most objects polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.notifyPropertyChange is more convenient, but collections sometimes deliver other types of changes such as a polymer/polymer.ListChangeRecord.

Notes: - This is not required for fields if you mixin or extend polymer/polymer.Observable, but you can use it for computed properties. - Unlike polymer/polymer.ChangeNotifier this will not schedule polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.deliverChanges; use polymer/observe-src-observable.Observable.dirtyCheck instead.

notifyPropertyChange.name: notifyPropertyChange
notifyPropertyChange.comment:
Notify that the field name of this object has been changed.

The polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.notifyPropertyChange.oldValue and polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.notifyPropertyChange.newValue are also recorded. If the two values are equal, no change will be recorded.

For convenience this returns polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.notifyPropertyChange.newValue. This makes it easy to use in a setter:

var _myField;
@reflectable get myField => _myField;
@reflectable set myField(value) {
  _myField = notifyPropertyChange(#myField, _myField, value);
}

observed.name: observed
observed.comment: Override this method to be called when the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.changes are first observed.

putIfAbsent.name: putIfAbsent
putIfAbsent.comment:
If polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.key is not associated to a value, calls polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent and updates the map by mapping polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.key to the value returned by polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent. Returns the value in the map.

Map<String, int> scores = {'Bob': 36};
for (var key in ['Bob', 'Rohan', 'Sophena']) {
  scores.putIfAbsent(key, () => key.length);
}
scores['Bob'];      // 36
scores['Rohan'];    //  5
scores['Sophena'];  //  7

The code that polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.putIfAbsent.ifAbsent executes must not add or remove keys.

remove.name: remove
remove.comment: Removes the association for the given polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.remove.key. Returns the value for polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.remove.key in the map or null if polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.remove.key is not in the map. Note that values can be null and a returned null value does not always imply that the key is absent.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

unobserved.name: unobserved
unobserved.comment: Override this method to be called when the polymer/polymer.ObservableMap.changes are no longer being observed.
